com.compomics.matching

Class MSRobin

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.compomics.matching.CumulativeBinomialProbabilityBasedScoring
      • com.compomics.matching.MSRobin
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Score_Interface

    public class MSRobin
extends CumulativeBinomialProbabilityBasedScoring
implements Score_Interface
    This class calculates cumulative binominal probability based scores with considering intensities from experimental spectra to cumulativeBinomialProbability these. n: number of matched peaks N: number of peaks of a spectrum with a bigger peak list p: probability,topN/windowSize from a Filter object. Note that topN is [1-10] Note that cumulative binominal probability function calculates the score as inclusive (not exclusive) Intensity_part(IP): [(0.5*(Explained_Intensities A/All_Intensities A))+(0.5*(Explained_Intensities B/All_intensitiesB))] For each filtered peakList with a given topN parameter, p is calculated as explained and cumulative binominal probability based scoring function part is calculated as: Probability_Part (PP) = -10*[-log(P)] Later on, intensity part is introduced as with two options: (option0) Final_score = PP*Sqrt(IP) (option1) Final_score = PP*IP *
    Author:
    Sule

    • Constructor Detail

      • MSRobin

        public MSRobin(double p,
               int N,
               int n,
               double intensity_part,
               int option)
        To construct an object to calculate MSRobin cumulativeBinomialProbability
        Parameters:
        p - probability,topN/windowSize from a Filter object. Note that topN is [1-10]
        N - number of peaks of a spectrum with a bigger peak list
        n - number of matched peaks between two experimental spectra
        intensity_part - a pre-calculated value while picking peaks
        option - 0-Intensities are squared, 1-No preprocessing on intensity part
